intro: Alaticaulia lintricula, commonly known as the narrow-leaved alaticaulia, is a rare and lesser-known species of flowering plant. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender stems and finely divided leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, preferring well-drained soils. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are arranged in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
